pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:0.5.eng: The training rule on one who is difficult to live with

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī purisasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ kumārakasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ caṇḍiṃ sokāvāsaṃ caṇḍakāḷiṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpeti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā gave the full admission to the trainee nun Caṇḍakāḷī, who was socializing with men and boys, and who was temperamental and difficult to live with.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.3.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.3.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā purisasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ kumārakasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ caṇḍiṃ sokāvāsaṃ caṇḍakāḷiṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.4.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give the full admission to the trainee nun Caṇḍakāḷī, who is socializing with men and boys, and who is temperamental and difficult to live with?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī purisasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ kumārakasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ caṇḍiṃ sokāvāsaṃ caṇḍakāḷiṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī purisasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ kumārakasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ caṇḍiṃ sokāvāsaṃ caṇḍakāḷiṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.8.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.10.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.11.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī purisasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ kumārakasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ caṇḍiṃ sokāvāsaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun who is socializing with men and boys and who is temperamental and difficult to live with, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.6.eng: those who have reached twenty years of age.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.8.eng: those who have not reached twenty years of age.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.10.eng: she socializes with improper bodily and verbal actions.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.14.eng: she causes suffering to others, and grieves herself.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.16.eng: one who has trained for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.19.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.19.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.20.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.20.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.21.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.22.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.23.pli: gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.1.23.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.2.2.eng: if she gives her the full admission without knowing what she is like;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc79:2.2.5.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:0.5.eng: The training rule on disposing of feces

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro brāhmaṇo nibbiṭṭharājabhaṭo “taññeva bhaṭapathaṃ yācissāmī”ti sīsaṃ nahāyitvā bhikkhunupassayaṃ nissāya rājakulaṃ gacchati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.2.eng: a brahmin who had earned money by working for the king thought, “I’ll ask for my wages.” After washing his hair, he walked past the nuns’ dwelling place on his way to the king’s residence.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.3.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī kaṭāhe vaccaṃ katvā tirokuṭṭe chaḍḍentī tassa brāhmaṇassa matthake āsumbhi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.3.eng: Just then, after defecating in a pot, a nun disposed of the feces over a wall, and it landed on the head of that brahmin.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.4.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.4.eng: He complained and criticized the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.6.eng: How can they dump shit on my head?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.7.eng: I’m gonna burn their place down!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.8.eng: And he got hold of a firebrand and entered their dwelling place.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.9.pli: Aññataro upāsako upassayā nikkhamanto addasa taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ ummukaṃ gahetvā upassayaṃ pavisantaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.9.eng: Just then a lay follower who was coming out from the nuns’ dwelling place saw that brahmin with a firebrand on his way in,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.11.pli: “kissa tvaṃ, bho, ummukaṃ gahetvā upassayaṃ pavisasī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.11.eng: “Sir, why are you entering the nuns’ dwelling place with a firebrand?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.12.pli: “Imā maṃ, bho, muṇḍā bandhakiniyo gūthakaṭāhaṃ matthake āsumbhiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.12.eng: “These shaven-headed sluts dumped shit on my head.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.13.eng: I’m gonna burn their place down!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.15.eng: You’ll get your wages and a thousand coins in addition.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.16.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo sīsaṃ nahāyitvā rājakulaṃ gantvā sahassaṃ alattha tañca bhaṭapathaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.16.eng: That brahmin then washed his hair, went to the king’s residence, and he got his wages and a thousand coins in addition.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.17.pli: Atha kho so upāsako upassayaṃ pavisitvā bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocetvā paribhāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.17.eng: But that lay follower returned to the nuns’ dwelling place, told them what had happened, and then scolded them.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.18.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.18.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.19.eng: “How can nuns dispose of feces over a wall?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.20.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo uccāraṃ tirokuṭṭe chaḍḍentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.20.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.23.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo uccāraṃ tirokuṭṭe chaḍḍessanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.23.eng: “How can nuns dispose of feces over a wall?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.25.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.25.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.26.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā saṅkāraṃ vā vighāsaṃ vā tirokuṭṭe vā tiropākāre vā chaḍḍeyya vā chaḍḍāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.26.1.eng: ‘If a nun disposes of feces or urine or trash or food scraps over a wall or over an encircling wall, or she has it disposed of in this way, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.12.pli: calakāni vā aṭṭhikāni vā ucchiṭṭhodakaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.12.eng: food remnants or bones or used water.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.14.eng: there are three kinds of walls: walls made of bricks, walls made of stone, walls made of wood.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.16.eng: there are three kinds of encircling walls: encircling walls made of bricks, encircling walls made of stone, encircling walls made of wood.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.18.eng: to the other side of the wall.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.20.eng: to the other side of the encircling wall.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.22.eng: if she disposes of it herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.24.eng: in asking another, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.25.pli: Sakiṃ āṇattā bahukampi chaḍḍeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.25.eng: If she only asks once, then even if the other disposes of such things many times, she commits one offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.2.eng: if she disposes of it after having looked;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.3.eng: if she disposes of it at a place where no one passes by;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.6.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:0.5.eng: The training rule on lack of permission

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī mātāpitūhipi sāmikenapi ananuññātaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpeti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā gave the full admission to a trainee nun who had not been given permission by her parents and her husband.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.2.comm: According to DOP, the combination na + pi should be understood as “nor”. In the present case the na is represented by the negation an in ananuññāta. We then have a neither-nor sentence, which makes it fit with the rule below. Reading the pi as “and” creates a discrepancy with the rule.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā amhehi ananuññātaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.4.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give the full admission to that trainee nun without our permission?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo mātāpitūnampi sāmikassapi ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of the parents and the husband.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā mātāpitūhipi sāmikenapi ananuññātaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.7.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give the full admission to a trainee nun who doesn’t have permission from her parents and her husband?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī, mātāpitūhipi sāmikenapi ananuññātaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī mātāpitūhipi sāmikenapi ananuññātaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.11.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī mātāpitūhi vā sāmikena vā ananuññātaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun who has not been given permission by her parents or her husband, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:1.14.1.comm: It is often understood that a woman needs permission from both her parents and her husband to ordain as a bhikkhunī. Yet the rule uses the conjunction vā, which can only reasonably be rendered as “or”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.6.eng: the biological parents is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.9.eng: Who has not been given permission:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.12.eng: one who has trained for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.15.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.15.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.16.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.16.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.17.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.18.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.19.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.1.19.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.2.2.eng: if she gives her the full admission without knowing;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.2.3.eng: if she gives her the full admission after permission has been given;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.2.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc80:2.2.6.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:0.5.eng: The training rule on what is expired

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī—

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.3.pli: “sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti there bhikkhū sannipātetvā pahūtaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ passitvā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.3.eng: had gathered a group of senior monks, intending to give the full admission to a trainee nun. But after seeing much fresh and cooked food, she dismissed the senior monks, saying,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.4.pli: “na tāvāhaṃ, ayyā, sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti there bhikkhū uyyojetvā devadattaṃ kokālikaṃ kaṭamodakatissakaṃ khaṇḍadeviyā puttaṃ samuddadattaṃ sannipātetvā sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.4.eng: “Venerables, I won’t give the full admission to the trainee nun just yet.” She then gathered Devadatta, Kokālika, Kaṭamodakatissaka, Khaṇḍadeviyāputta, and Samuddadatta, and gave the full admission to that trainee nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.5.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.5.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā pārivāsikachandadānena sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.6.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give the full admission to a trainee nun when the given consent had expired?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī pārivāsikachandadānena sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī pārivāsikachandadānena sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.10.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.12.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.13.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī pārivāsikachandadānena sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:1.13.1.eng: ‘If, when a given consent has expired, a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.5.eng: When a given consent has expired:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.6.comm: In other words, consent is given for a specific meeting of the Sangha. When the meeting is over—that is, the gathering has left—the consent is no longer valid. See the discussion in Appendix on Individual Bhikkhunī Rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.8.eng: one who has trained for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.11.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.11.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.12.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.12.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.13.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.14.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.15.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.15.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.2.2.eng: if she gives her the full admission while the gathering has not yet left;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.2.5.eng: The eleventh training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:0.5.eng: The training rule on every year

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo anuvassaṃ vuṭṭhāpenti, upassayo na sammati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns were giving full admission every year, and the nuns’ dwelling place did not have sufficient capacity.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo anuvassaṃ vuṭṭhāpessanti, upassayo na sammatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.4.eng: “How can the nuns give full admission every year, when the nuns’ dwelling place doesn’t have sufficient capacity?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns give full admission every year?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo anuvassaṃ vuṭṭhāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives full admission every year, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.1.9.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.1.9.eng: If, intending to give full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.1.10.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.1.10.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.1.11.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.1.12.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.1.13.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.1.13.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.2.2.eng: if she gives full admission every other year;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc82:2.2.5.eng: The twelfth training rule is finished.
